item.title: Water not draining opposite Thatcham Court in the slip road, 21st January
item.description:
Every time it rains water collected in the slip road and is a drenching hazard for pedestrians when cars use the slip road to bypass the high road traffic. I was soaked by one car and was just recovering when another car sped by and drenched me again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1443 - 1465, High Road, Whetstone, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car with no MOT dumped on public road for past month, 21st January
item.description:
Car dumped opposite 67 Wrottesley Road has no valid MOT. Area is notorious for cars being dumped, hasn’t moved for a month. Photos taken 21st January 2026.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Keeble Close, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Open green utility box, 21st January
item.description:
This box has been left open for well over a year and is a risk to the safety of children and possible vandalism which could impact the homes it serves. There is no label or contact details on the box. The council needs to send the appropriate team or contact the relevant provider and ensure the cabinet is secured in the interest of safety and security. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Longmead Drive, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black prince/ A2 flyover, 21st January
item.description:
The flyover at the black prince over the A2 there are a few potholes that require urgent attention as there are in a very poor standard and now need to be driven around them to avoid damaging your vehicle. I have been informed that the potholes don’t meet the council requirements to be repaired, as l have reported this issue a few time over the last few months, if there an damage to my vehicle l will claim compensation
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Major pathholes, with leaks, 21st January
item.description:
There has been a leak on the street for several days. It does not appear to be a water leak, as the liquid is not transparent and looks more like sewage. From the point where the liquid is emerging, there are two large potholes and debris on the road, and it appears that the road surface is sinking. The potholes are located in the middle of a dual carriageway, creating a serious hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lennox Road, Finsbury Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a pothole at this pothole at this junction, 21st January
item.description:
The pothole is in a dangerous location at the junction which causes vehicle to drive around the pothole to avoid any damage to there vehicle, by driving around the pothole it could cause an accident with other oncoming vehicles
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 69, Hind Crescent, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
